tweets.text:
Environmental challenges like #AirPollution affect everyone, and everyone should have a voice in the conversation about our future - especially children.

So, we‚Äôve created #GrandmasFootstepsStory, a short children's story inspired by pollution research.

https://t.co/xO4U7CbXlQ

Serious questions for @EnvAgency as council chief reveals levels of hydrogen sulphide at landfill were at dangerous levels in May last year - @AaronBell4NUL says it has been too slow https://t.co/4fqu2dsZon

New video from @SMARTER_BufferZ @Teagasc @JamesHuttonInst highlighting  various buffer options to improve water quality https://t.co/BRQ4LFe6qt
 #TeagascJC

Off to the beach? Our teams are out taking samples today from 55 of the 400+ bathing waters we monitor. #EAscientists analyse samples and upload results to Swimfo regularly from May to September https://t.co/MGq6Hx1BXT #EnviroCensus #GreatBritishSummer https://t.co/HqZ0eJT4rH

2021 was census year for the UK. Every day is environmental census day at the Environment Agency. #EAscientists collect and analyse a host of environmental data, including on river flows, air quality, water quality and aquatic ecosystems. Follow the action tomorrow #EnviroCensus https://t.co/rgvpiE7JkH

Fantastic real life science going on at the @EnvAgency this week as the #EAscientists carry out the #EnviroCensus

A ¬£275,000 culvert repair project, which will reduce #flood risk to 697 properties in #Liverpool, has completed 2 weeks ahead of schedule! 

Working with @lpoolcouncil & @wsp the project saw 22m of reinforced units installed on the culverted watercourse around Clubmoor & Tuebrook https://t.co/0p95X2WDm6
